Last night on Rach Mieu bridge,
My Tho city, Tien Giang province, a traffic accident occurred.
A traffic accident killed one person
at around 7:00 p.m. a young man living in
Binh Dai district, Ben Tre province, was driving a
motorbike through the bridge in the direction
from Ben Tre to Tien Giang while
moving across the motorbike bridge.  Collision with a
car traveling in the same direction caused the
young man to fall onto the road and was
hit by another car running in the opposite direction. The
victim died on the spot immediately afterward. My
Tho City Police were present at the
scene.  Regulating traffic and handling the
scene of the
[music]
accident also in Tien Giang province at 5 o'clock yesterday
afternoon on the steel wire line in Than Duc hamlet, Than Cuu
Nghia commune, Chan
Thanh district, I heard the sound of a shoulder hitting hard on the
road.  Everyone ran out to see and
discovered a man about 60 years old with an
injured crutch lying next to a motorbike with
license plate 63 F5 4138 and a young man
over 20 years old who was stabbed to death. Immediately
after that, the man was rescued by people.
Assisted in taking to hospital Than Cuu Nghia commune police were
also present at the scene
to investigate the cause of the
accident. Yesterday, the body of a young man
was discovered by people in the
Saigon River in Binh Duong province.
Initial information  On the evening of the same day, a large number of
people gathered at Bach
Dang Park, Phu Cuong Ward, Thu Dau
1 City to take a walk to admire the scenery. Suddenly, many
people saw a body floating on the
Saigon River and reported it to the
police authorities.  After that, they were present and blocked
the scene to recover the body. The shore where
the body was discovered is the My Hao Binh My ferry area
connecting Thu Dau 1 city with
Cu Chi district, Ho Chi Minh City. The
victim was a male about 20 years old.  30 years old,
wearing shorts and a black T-shirt,
without identification papers. The
body is starting to decompose. The body
has now been transferred to the morgue for investigation
to clarify the cause of death and
verify the identity.  About the
victim yesterday, An Giang province police
discovered a case of transporting
imported cigarettes from Cambodia to Vietnam
around 5:00 a.m. on the same day
while patrolling the border in
Ba Bai hamlet area.  Vinh Te commune,
Chau Doc city, An Giang province's economic police force
discovered a
suspect transporting prohibited goods driving a
motorboat from Cambodia to
Vietnam. Checking the vehicle, the
authorities discovered it.  The machine contained
nearly 1,700 packs of foreign cigarettes. The suspect,
Nguyen Van Chao in Chau Doc city,
admitted that he was waiting to rent the above smuggled cigarettes
to an abuser for a fee of
350,000 VND per trip. The authorities
are continuing.  Investigate to handle the
subject according to the
next law in the international information section.

new ladies and gentlemen yesterday at least 11 people
were killed and more than 100 injured
in an explosion at a fireworks factory in the
central Indian state of Maria prades according to
local officials the
expected death toll is  continued to
increase according to India Today newspaper. The factory
was carrying a large amount of fireworks, so the
explosion was so powerful that it caused more than 50
houses near the factory to burn, according to
local officials, at least 70 ambulances
and military personnel.  The team was mobilized
to the scene at the time of the explosion.
There were about 200 to 300 workers
working at the factory. The Times of India
quoted the police as saying that some people were
killed due to trampling of defense offices.
General Naren Rami sent his condolences and
said he would support the families of victims of
fireworks, which are popular in India, especially
during the Hindu festival of Diwali and
weddings. However, many factories do not
comply with safety rules.  safe and operating

I'm blind. Welcome to
Blind dance radio. I'm DJ actin and

song.  song I made myself to

braille, thereby helping him organize

I want to inspire

other type of disability, to boldly

play at Tomorrow Land, one of the

The country in the capital city of

New Year. To get satisfactory images,
Bear Care staff
struggled.  In order for them to cooperate while

so it took a lot of time for
everyone to control them and
complete the scenes. We wish
you all the best of luck in the year of Giap
Thinh.  The pandas also sent their
blessings to you. This is the first time 34
pandas appeared in public
with the message Wishing everyone
a happy and prosperous new year.

is a big problem. Every heat season,
a female cat can  Giving birth to two or three litters of
four to six kittens each does not have enough
heat to keep them warm so sterilization is
necessary. Last year, the center trapped and
sterilized and released more than
600 stray cats back into the community after sterilization.

Updated information, ladies and gentlemen. On
February 6, a US federal appeals court
issued a Ninth Judgment.  President Donald
Trump does not enjoy immunity from
prosecution against charges related to
overturning the 2020 election results. The
three-judge panel of the
federal appeals court in Washington unanimously
dismissed the previous argument.  Mr.
Trump's claim that he cannot be prosecuted on
charges brought related to
his official responsibilities
as president. This argument of Mr.
Trump's has caused the trial of the
criminal case to be delayed.  The appeals court
gave Mr. Trump until February 12
to appeal to the US Supreme Court.
Mr. Trump's 2024 presidential campaign said he would
appeal and said any
President  Every American must enjoy
absolute immunity, while the
White House and
incumbent President Joe Biden's re-election campaign refused to
comment on the case of Mr. Trump facing
four charges in a criminal case related to the United States.
Regarding efforts to overturn the results of the
2020 election, including conspiracy to
defraud the United States and conspiracy to obstruct
official proceedings, he pleaded not guilty and accused
prosecutors of damaging
his election campaign.  The
